intro: Leobordea esterhuyseniana, commonly known as the Esterhuysen's leobordea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions and low rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
